verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:1
verses.text: The misfortunes of the Book of Balaam, son of Beor. A divine seer was he.

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:2
verses.text:
The gods came to him at night. And he beheld a vision in accordance with El's utterance. They said to Balaam, son of Beor:  
"So will it be done, with naught surviving.  
No one has seen [the likes of] what you have heard!"

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:5
verses.text:
Balaam arose on the morrow;  
He summoned the heads of the assembly to him,

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:6
verses.text:
And for two days he fasted and wept bitterly.  
Then his intimates entered into his presence,  
and they said to Balaam, son of Beor,  
"Why do you fast, and why do you weep?"

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:7
verses.text:
Then he said to them:  
"Be seated, and I will relate to you what the Shaddai gods have planned,  
And go, see the acts of the god!  

The gods have banded together;

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:8
Balaam Inscription 1:9
verses.text:
So that you instill dread in dense darkness.  
And - never utter a sound again!'

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:10
verses.text:
It shall be that the swift and crane will shriek insult to the eagle,  
And a nest of vultures shall cry out in response.  
The stork, the young of the falcon and the owl,

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:11
verses.text:
The chicks of the heron, sparrow and cluster of eagles;  
Pigeons and birds, [and fowl in the s]ky.  
And a rod [shall flay the cat]tle;  
Where there are ewes, a staff shall be brought.  
Hares - eat together!  
Free[ly feed], oh beasts [of the field]!  
And [freely] drink, asses and hyenas!"

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:12
Balaam Inscription 1:14
verses.text:
To a perfumer of myrrh and a priestess.  
Who covers his body with oil,  
And rubs himself with olive oil.  
To one bearing an offering in a horn;  
One augurer after another, and yet another.  
As one augurer broke away from his colleagues,  
The strikers departed ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:15
verses.text:
They heard incantations from afar  
...  
Then disease was unleashed

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:16
verses.text:
And all beheld acts of distress.  
Shagar-and-Ištar did not ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 1:17
verses.text:
The piglet [drove out] the leopard  
And the ... drove out the young of the ...  
... double offerings  
And he beheld ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:4
verses.text: .. a girl those who were used? to be saturated with love ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:5
verses.text: .. a blinded one and the whole moistened? soil? ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:6
Balaam Inscription 2:7
verses.text:
A house where no traveler enters  
Nor does a bridegroom enter there

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:8
verses.text:
Worm rot from a grave.  
From the reckless affairs of men.  
And from the lustful desires of people.  
... for me

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:9
verses.text:
If it is for counsel, one will not counsel with you!  
Or for advising him, one will not take advice!  
He breaks ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:10
verses.text:

One, behold, you hate him!  
He will be mortally afflicted. If you ...  
...  
... punishment.  
[Worm rot] is under your head.  
You shall lie on your eternal bedding,  
To pass away to ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:12
verses.text:
all ... in their heart.  
The corpse moans in his heart,  
He moans ...  
... a daughter.  
There, kings shall behold ּBal[aam]

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:13
verses.text:
There is no mercy when Death seizes an infant.  
And an infant ...  
An infant ...  
There ... shall endure.

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:14
verses.text:
The heart of the corpse is desolate  
As he approaches [Sheol].  
...  
To the edge of She[ol],  
And the shadow of the hedge ...

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:15
verses.text:
"The quest of a king becomes his moth (rot),  
And the quest of ...  
... and ... seers.

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:16
verses.text:
Your quest is distant from you.  
Why ...  
To know how to deliver an oracle to his people.  
You have been condemned for your speech

verses.name: Balaam Inscription 2:17
verses.text:
And [banned] from pronouncing words of execration.
